metadata.title: CVE-2021-3348 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
nbd_add_socket in drivers/block/nbd.c in the Linux kernel through 5.10.12has an ndb_queue_rq use-after-free that could be triggered by localattackers (with access to the nbd device) via an I/O request at a certainpoint during device setup, aka CID-b98e762e3d71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1098-aws - 4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1112-azure - 4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1097-gcp - 4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1069-oracle - 4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was pending').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.105~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1112.124~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1097.110~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1069.77~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
